answers.answer: GO SEEK MEDICAL HELP IMMEDIATELY. YOU MAY BE SUFFERING FROM A RETINAL DETACHMENT. AND DUE TO THE TYPE 2 DIABETES IT MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY DIABETIC RETINOPATHY. AGAIN, CALL AN EYE MD NOW!!!!!

I'm with berrywoo. Since you have diabetes, I would see a retinal subspecialist directly to evaluate your symptoms. When you call, describe this event and ask to be seen "today" on an emergency basis.

question: I've had floaters for years. recently in a 1 day span, a very large floater appeared in my right eye, within a few hours my eye sight in the same eye became completely blurred,like looking through a sheet of celophane.seems to have all ear marks of a floater.slowly moves around but 100% blur. I have been type2 diabetic for 30 years.  Thank You   Mike
title: eye floater
